ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Great way for Div Students to learn about the theologies and the canon-development of Jewish texts in the century around Jesus' time - from 2nd Temple Judaism through the 5th/6th century -- theologies that interact with the development of Christianity and are foundational to contemporary Judaism.Yes, I'd recommend the class. I am a 3rd year MDiv and this has one of the most reasonable workloads of any class I've taken which meant I actually was able to do most of the reading.
I would recommend it. It's a great course to learn about 1000 years worth of history
I would recommend Judaic Studies 721 to anyone who seeks to gain information about early Judaic history and culture.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I am headed towards ordination next month and expect to use A LOT of what I learned in explaining the context of early Christianity in sermons, adult formation classes and preparing people for baptism/ confirmation.
It helped a lot - I was pretty ignorant about Rabbinic Judaism. I loved learning about it, so it filled a lacuna.
This course gave me enthusiasm to continue learning about Judaism. Brilliant course!
Great introduction for me to the development of rabbinic judaism. Will be very helpful in the future.
